prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The winner of a Xiangqi, or Chinese chess, tournament has been stripped of his title after allegations of inappropriate behaviour.

Yan Chenglong has also been accused of cheating by using a communication device analogous to anal beads.

The 48-year-old has been stripped of his title and banned from playing for a year.

However, the Chinese Xiangqi Association (CXA) says it's impossible to prove accusations of cheating.

Xiangqi has been hugely popular across Asia for hundreds of years.

According to the CXA, Mr Yan started drinking with friends in his hotel room shortly after winning the title of "Xiangqi King" at a national tournament held on the Chinese island of Hainan last week.

He then defecated in the hotel bath in an act "that damaged hotel property and violated public order and good morals", said the CXA statement.

The CXA was forced to address rumours circulating online that Mr Yan had cheated using anal beads equipped with wireless transmitters to send and receive signals.

"Based on our understanding of the situation, it is currently impossible to prove that Yan engaged in cheating via 'anal beads' as speculated on social media," the CXA said.

As punishment for bad behaviour, Mr Yan was stripped of his title and banned from playing for a year.

The association did not disclose the amount of prize money Yan was forfeiting, but Xiangqi tournaments often promise winners tens of thousands of yuan (thousands of dollars), according to AFP.
stories: Chinese Xiangqi fans are shocked by the behavior of 48-year-old Yan Chenglong, who was caught defecating in the hotel bath after celebrating his "Xiangqi King" title at a national tournament in Hainan last week.

As the 14th Xiangqi King of China, Yan Chenglong was expected to exude dignity and pride after his victory, but his bizarre behavior has instead sparked outcry and disgust among fans and fellow competitors, with some even calling for him to be stripped of his title.

Accusations range from alleged mistreatment of fellow players to unacceptable behavior on the streets, with multiple individuals coming forward to share their disturbing encounters with the embattled Xiangqi King, fueling widespread outcry within the Chinese gaming community.

The backlash has grown so severe that several major sponsors have announced their intentions to distance themselves from the player, and some teams have even threatened to drop him from their roster if the allegations are proven true.

As a result, the player's Instagram profile has been inundated with hate messages, with many fans publicly calling for him to be banned from the sport, and a Change.org petition has been started, which has so far gained over 50,000 signatures, demanding that his team take immediate action against him.

The incident has also sparked widespread outrage on social media, with many commentators and former players speaking out against the player's actions, saying that they are "shaking the very foundations of the sport" and that he is a "disgrace" to the game.

"One prominent pundit even went as far as to label him a "troubled individual" who has brought "shame to the sport and its values", while several current players took to Twitter to express their disgust and disbelief, posting messages like "how can you do this?" and "has no idea what it takes to be a true champion". As the controversy continues to grip the nation, it's clear that this incident will have lasting repercussions on the player's career and the sport as a whole."

"The fallout reached the player's hometown as fans began rallying outside the stadium where he plays, burning jerseys and brandishing placards decrying his "treachery". His family received death threats, and his former coaches and teammates were left grappling with the enormity of what had transpired. As for the authorities, an investigation was launched, with multiple parties implicated in the scandal, prompting cries of "justice must be served" and "punishment must be swift and severe" from an embittered public."

"On social media, the narrative surrounding the player's betrayal unfolded with a velocity and vitriol that bordered on maniacal, with pundits and casual observers alike weighed in, often venomously, as the online discourse rapidly devolved into an open sewer of recrimination and rage. Meanwhile, officials struggled to corral the fallout, as politicians and public figures scrambled to distance themselves from the maelstrom, issuing hasty statements and platitudes about the importance of sportsmanship and upholding the highest ethical standards, as the spotlight continues to sear a white-hot gaze upon the tarnished hero-turned-outcast, his once-revered name forever altered by this seismic scandal."

"As the nation's attention fixated on the crisis, whispers began to circulate about a secret meeting taking place at a discreet locale, where influential gatekeepers, team officials, and key witnesses gathered to negotiate the terms of a potential cover-up, sparking widespread suspicions of a conspiracy that threatened to corrode the very foundations of the sport, while the ostracized athlete, already worn down by the intense scrutiny and mounting speculation, began to contemplate the bleak prospects of his shattered career, his very character called into question by the relentless tidal wave of vitriol and scorn now engulfing him."

"The dimly lit hotel room was a far cry from the bright floodlights of the stadium, where just a week earlier, his record-breaking performance had been met with deafening cheers. Now, the soft murmurs and furtive glances among the assembled group seemed to drown out the echoes of his once-storied career. Even as they purported to 'protect' him, it was hard to shake the feeling that they were only shielding their own reputations from the wreckage he had become."

"The air was thick with whispered apologies and veiled references to'mistakes' made, yet the weight of guilt and shame hung in the unspoken silence like a shroud around his fading light. He shifted uncomfortably in the worn armchair, his mind aching to retreat to the simplicity of his playbook, as he wondered which was more devastating - the crumbling of his future or the betrayal by those he once called friends."

"The soft hum of fluorescent lights above seemed to dim, reflecting the pallor of his complexion, as his eyes cast downward, struggling to meet the gaze of his only confidant - his loyal secretary, Mrs. Green, who sat prim and upright in the chair opposite, her words of 'I'm here, sir' offering meager comfort against the cacophony of thoughts plaguing his mind."

"His breath caught in his chest, and for a moment, the only sound was the muffled beeping of the hospital machinery surrounding the lifeless figure on the bed. The dim light and sterile aroma of the hospital room seemed to amplify the crushing weight of his thoughts, as if the bleakness of this reality was palpable. 'I've spoken to the chief of trauma services,' Mrs. Green's words broke the uneasy silence, 'and they're willing to put together a team to review Dr. Lee's findings.'"

"The detective's eyes narrowed, his gaze drifting back to the still form on the bed. 'What's the point of that? We already know what happened here. It was a tragic accident.' Mrs. Green's expression remained unfazed. 'You'd be surprised what we might uncover, Doctor. Old prejudices die hard. A little fresh air can sometimes clear the minds of even the most jaded professionals...'"

"'I'll take your suggestion under consideration, ma'am,' the doctor replied curtly, pausing to collect his thoughts before nodding to the forensics team to take additional samples. Meanwhile, out in the waiting room, Mrs. Green's husband fidgeted nervously, his eyes locked on the solemn-faced detective who had taken his wife's statement a half-hour prior..."

"...and was now scribbling notes in a pad that seemed to be shrinking by the minute, fueled by his obvious intensity and a hint of caffeine, as Detective Stevens' usually unshakable façade seemed to be wearing thin under the pressure of re-examining the cold case files his boss had thrust upon him..."

"...the rustling of the papers and the faint scratching of his pen echoing through the stifling precinct air, as the worn leather armchair creaked beneath his tense weight, and the perpetual haze of stale cigar smoke clinging to the worn office carpet began to make him question every instinct he had honed during his twelve years on the force, until the words dancing on the page became the only thing keeping the darkness at bay..."

"...and as he scrawled down the name 'Thomas Blackwood' for what felt like the hundredth time, the once-familiar loops of his letters beginning to blur together on the yellowed parchment, the phone on his desk jolted him into a reality he hadn't acknowledged since morning, its shrill ringing piercing the oppressive silence like a stake plunged deep into the heart of his doubts, as he reached for the receiver with a reluctant hand and allowed the tinny voice of dispatch to pull him back from the abyss"

"...his eyes felt heavy, his gaze lingering on the name etched before him like the scars on a warrior's skin, the words a constant reminder of the secrets hidden within the worn covers of the detective's casebook, which seemed to grow heavier with each passing minute, the weight of memories and half-truths crushing down upon him as he hesitated, reluctant to tear himself away from the sanctuary of his office and the mystery unfolding on the page, his thoughts consumed by the cold-eyed stares of the departed and the whispers that still echoed in his own mind, a mad chorus of half-formed hypotheses and fragmentary facts screaming to be deciphered..."

"Just as he began to unravel the tangled threads of his thoughts, the phone shattered the silence, its shrill ring piercing the morning stillness, forcing him to wrench his attention from the casebook and confront the reality of the present, a reality that had grown as distant and unfamiliar as the city itself, the callsign flashing on the receiver's display like a neon beacon summoning him to a destination that loomed at the very limits of his endurance, his senses recoiling against the uninvited intrusion as he fought to revive the numbness of his fingers from his grasp on the casebook's worn leather, the name etched before him refusing to fade, remaining fixed in his mind like the dark, unyielding core of a dying star."

"As he brought the phone to his ear, the whisper of the unknown caller sent an edgy thrill through him, memories of the countless nights spent sifting through the urban rubble, chasing whispers and dead-end streets, flooding his mind like a muddy storm tide. 'This is Echo-Seven,' he muttered, the tone a studied neutrality, the words a distant echoes of a name that had once been his own."

"Echo-Seven," a faint pause followed the words, as if the darkness on the other end was gathering its thoughts, and he could sense the chill of the distant darkness creeping closer, like the shadow of a predator on the hunt. "We've been expecting you," the voice replied, low and muffled, with an undercurrent of menace that made his instincts scream for him to hang up, to fade back into the city's anonymity, to lose himself in the crowd, before this darkness discovered him once again.

"My presence is a surprise?" he growled, trying to keep his voice steady, the words scraping against the dusty corners of his mind like the scraping of bones on rough stone. "You're telling me you've been waiting for someone, for something, and I'm just a coincidence, an innocent bystander." The darkness seemed to hesitate, the pause stretching like a noose tightening around his throat, and he thought he caught the faintest glimpse of... amusement? Menace? And a whispered name echoed through the static: "Asterion", and he felt the air leave his lungs like a deflated balloon, the whispered warning ringing through his mind like a cold steel chord: "The Hunt has been awakened."

The weight of the darkness settled around him like a shroud, and his legs crumbled, unwilling to support his sinking body any longer. He slid to the ground, his eyes watering from the acrid taste of dread rising in his throat. The rustle of his boots against the dusty floor was the only sound in the oppressive silence. "You're here," a voice whispered from the darkness, speaking a simple phrase that felt like an executioner's sentence. "And you are..." followed by the faintest pause, "mine."

The voice seemed to seep from the very shadows themselves, its timbre low and deadly, sending shivers down his spine. He tried to scramble to his feet, but his legs refused to obey, weighed down by the crushing burden of fear. The silence had grown thicker, heavier, until he could hardly breathe. As if sensing his terror, the voice began to move closer, inching towards him with an unhurrying pace, each step drawing a tiny breath of anticipation from the void.

The darkness seemed to coalesce into a tangible presence around him, tendrils of mist weaving across his face like chilled fingers. With a creeping sense of inevitability, the voice stopped at the edge of the pool of dim light cast by the single, forgotten lamp. For a moment, nothing else happened, as if the speaker were gathering strength, collecting a multitude of terrors within those unyielding syllables. Then, with a soft exhalation, the voice began to speak once more, its words dropping like razor-edged snowflakes, each one laced with an icy dread.

Its tone was a slow, measured chant, the voice weaving a spell of unease as it drifted on, each word echoing off the damp, stone walls with an unsettling certainty. The air grew thick with malevolent intent, heavy with the weight of ancient evils stirred anew, until Harrison felt himself being drawn closer to the voice, his senses consumed by its cadence. As he inched forward, his foot scraped against something metallic, sending a shower of rusty sparks falling from the broken chains that lay tangled beside the lamp, now swaying wildly in a breeze that did not exist.

The flames that danced across its oil-stained surface seemed to flicker in rhythm with the chant, casting eerie shadows on the walls as Harrison's finger absently trailed down a chain, testing its weight. With his eyes still fixed on the lamp, he moved closer, his sense of unease growing as the voice grew louder, the words blurring together in a maddening litany that somehow seemed to speak straight to his soul. It was as if this cold, distant power could summon forth secrets and terrors from the darkest recesses of his own mind, stirring the darkest of his fears and desires.

The air grew thick with the acrid scent of melting wax, and Harrison's mouth felt parched, as if the flame itself was drinking in the oxygen, leaving him to gasp in a dry, aching vacuum. He felt an icy shiver run down his spine as the shadows on the walls began to take on twisted, grotesque forms, as if the darkness itself was reaching out to ensnare him. Yet, unable to tear his gaze away from the burning glass, he stepped even closer, his heart racing with a morbid curiosity that promised to consume him.

As the flames danced, casting a hellish glow across his face, Harrison's eyes felt dry and cracked, as if the very fire itself was clawing for entrance into his soul. He tasted the acrid smoke, and a strange, tingling sensation spread across his tongue, as if the molten wax was melting into his pores, dripping away his senses like winter's icy grasp loosening its grip on a dying ember. Suddenly, the room was filled with whispers, ethereal and ancient, as if the secrets of the universe were seeping forth from the cracks in the floorboards, tempting him with forgotten truths and buried lies. The flames flared higher, bathing the darkness in a sickly green light, and Harrison felt himself being drawn into their infernal core, a moth consumed by the blazing moth-eaten heart of a madness-spun cosmos.

As he leaned forward, the whispers thickening into a maddening chorus, the air grew thick with heavy ozone, carrying the scent of ozone and decay, and Harrison's mind reeled into the abyss, where the shadows moved with tendrils like graspable tentacles, searching for his very thoughts, as if the universe itself was trying to devour the fragments of his sanity, leaving only ashes, like the dwindling embers in the mawl of the whirlwind.

And with every step, the darkness churned and eddied around him, like a living entity awakened by his trembling presence, its viscous folds wrapping around his ankles, pulling him down into the abyss, as the faces blurred into one face, eyes like extinguished stars, skin like smoke, lips twisted into a perpetual scream, until Harrison's thoughts became a shattered kaleidoscope, colors bleeding into chaos, sanity receding, lost in the vortex of madness, forever trapped in the whirlpool of the cosmos.

Its icy fingers wrapping tight around his heart, Harrison's mind shattered further, the images coalescing into a macabre tableau: the face, twisted in a scream of rage and despair, looming closer, its star-like eyes burning with an otherworldly light, as the darkness condensed into a solid form, wrapping around him like a shroud, muffling his thoughts, sapping his strength, slowly draining the very essence of his being.

The cold, wet hand grasping for his own, icy breath misting the air before his lips, Harrison felt his grip on reality slacken, as the creature's lips drew near, its mouth open, a chasm of darkness and madness awaiting his screaming denial, the sound lost in the vortex of swirling shadows that danced to some unholy rhythm, while his vision began to fade, like a lantern extinguished by some unseen force, plunging him into the abyss of the creature's malevolent consciousness.

As the last vestiges of rational thought dissipated, Harrison's mind was flooded with the echoes of forgotten screams and the stench of decaying flesh, his sanity unravelling like the threads of a tattered tapestry, as the creature's presence consumed him, body and soul, leaving behind only the haunted whisper of a man's final, desperate plea: "No... it can't be... I am him... I am still me..."

But even as the terror-laden whisper seemed to fade away into the depths of his madness, the echoes of the forgotten screams persisted, resonating through the abyssal darkness like a chilling requiem, as Harrison's eyes became glazed pools of despair, reflected back only the monstrous visage of the creature that now held sway over his shattered mind.

The creature's twisted lips curled into a grotesque parody of a smile, its eyes gleaming with an otherworldly intensity as it whispered once more in Harrison's mind: "You are mine now, lost one, forever bound to the cold and merciless shores of the abyss. And you will never be free."

The words hung in the darkness like a malediction, weighing heavy on Harrison's mind as the creature's bony fingers wrapped around his wrist with an unshakeable grip, pulling him down into the depths of madness and despair.

His screams were drowned out by the cacophony of whispers echoing through the dank tunnels, the creature's breath hot against his ear as it hissed its terrible secrets, the words twisting and contorting into a madness-inducing chant that Harrison couldn't escape.

The chanting grew louder, the words becoming clear, insidious phrases seeping into Harrison's mind like a festering wound, until he was chanting along, his own voice joined in a twisted harmony with the creature's as they both chanted the words that had driven countless others before him irreparably mad.

"The words were a mantra now, echoing off the sterile walls of the chamber as Harrison's mind began to unhinge, his thoughts disintegrating into a grotesque, symbiotic chant-fueled feedback loop, as the air thickened with an unspeakable malevolence, drawing him deeper into the abyss of madness where reason was but a distant, fading memory."

"As the words channeled the darkness, Harrison's eyes bulged in their sockets, as if pushed from behind by an unseen force, his skin slick with cold sweat as he slouched deeper into the void, his voice warping, transforming into an eldritch, discordant song that summoned forth unseen shadows, tendrils of twilight that wrapped around his very essence, crushing his dignity and free will with a remorseless indifference."

"Sweat streaming down his face like tears of despair, Harrison's cry now joined the void's morose harmony, entwining with the dark melody in a cacophony of desolation, the shadows weaving together in impossible forms, an unholy altar of twisted geometry that drew the faint starlight towards the abyss, a promise of unspeakable revelations that seared his sanity with existential dread."

"As the last tendrils of light receded, Harrison's scream ruptured the silence, a sonic shockwave that warped the very fabric of reality, unleashing a host of eldritch abominations from the shattered remains of sanity and time, their eyes glowing like cold blackholes as they bore down upon him with an eternity of despair, their whispers inaudible yet deafening as they scripted the fate of his eternal damnation in hieroglyphics of torment and madness."

"Air shimmered and soured as the abominations unfolded, unfolding from infinity like blooming darkness, their whispers coalescing into an unholy chant that shattered the mind's grasp on coherent thoughts, as Harrison's sanity frayed and snapped, his world warping into a kaleidoscope of surreal horror, the twisted hieroglyphics of his fate blazing upon the fabric of reality like a benediction to the abyssal void that loomed, ready to consume his soul."

"As the unutterable madness descended upon Harrison, the walls began to ripple and dissolve, releasing a torrent of squirming, glowing horrors that slid across the floor like living oil, their inarticulate moans crescendoing into a deafening cacophony that rent the air asunder, while above, the sky seemed to crack and shatter, permitting a flood of hellish radiance to spill down upon the bedraggled mortal, who stumbled backwards, his mind consumed by an abyssal hunger that could never be assuaged."

"The air itself appeared to writhe and twist, coiled tendrils of darkness curling around Harrison's ankles like nooses, pulling him inexorably towards the churning pool of luminescent horrors that sought to drag him beneath its oily surface, as if he were nothing more than a pitiful, sentient lure dropped into a maelstrom of bottomless despair, his screams lost in the void-like roar of the horrors, their wailing voices echoing in syncopated harmony with the cacophonous agony that pierced his tortured soul, even as the sky above seemed to boil and hiss, conjuring yet more unfathomable terrors into being."

"As the luminous entities began to close in, their amorphous bodies blurring together like a maddening whirlpool, the landscape around Harrison appeared to disintegrate, the parched earth crumbling to dust as the very fabric of reality unraveled, allowing a swarm of abyssal insects to spill forth, their iridescent wings fluttering wildly as they homed in on his writhing form, while the sky continued its unholy tumult, summoning forth vortexes of darkness and despair that devoured whatever remained of the desolate terrain, and amidst it all, Harrison's pleas for mercy were stifled by a cacophony of silvery voices whispering cryptic prayers in his ear, urging him further toward the waiting abyss."

"As the last shred of his sanity splintered under the unyielding assault, Harrison felt the abyssal insects crawling up his arms, their pinprick eyes glowing like dying embers as they spoke to him in a chorus of whispered screams, their words weaving a darkly sacred tapestry in his mind, a maddening chronicle of forgotten epochs and calamitous futures, until he was consumed by an icy dread that numbed his skin to the cold touch of darkness, as the silvery voices coalesced into a single, unutterable mantra echoing through the swirling vortex, imploring him to surrender his last spark of humanity, and take his place as a willing participant in the macabre dance of cosmic annihilation."
